title: Multi-Functional Bot Setup
text: Setting multi-functional bot slightly complex single-channel one. Go https://api.slack.com/apps Click “Create New App” follow setup instructions Click “OAuth & Permissions” “Features” Enable following scopes order get functionality: channels:read users:read files:read groups:read groups:write chat:write chat:write.customize chat:write.public im:write incoming-webhook channels:history Click “Install Workspace” Select channel (webhook messages) Copy Bot User (User, depending type app want use) OAuth Access Token Click “Incoming Webhooks” “Features” Copy Webhook URL Call can also follow config file setup directions instead passing channel, token, webhook directly. ’s ! able post message slackr('test message')
code: slackr_setup(channel = '#channel_with_webhook',               token = 'your_token',               incoming_webhook_url = 'your_webhook')

title: Multi-Functional Bot Setup
text: Without scopes enabled, certain functions work. ones depends scopes enabled. See function documentation scopes needed function.

title: Multi-Functional Bot Setup
code: library(slackr) slackr_setup(   channel = "<< channel >>",   incoming_webhook_url = "https://hooks.slack.com/services/<< hook >>",   token = "xoxb-<< token >>" )  slackr(str(iris))  # send images library(ggplot2) qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars) slackr_dev("#results")  barplot(VADeaths) slackr_dev("@jayjacobs")  ggslackr(qplot(mpg, wt, data = mtcars))

title: Multi-Functional Bot Setup
text: new function slackr_tex versions 2.0.0+ requires package texPreview lazy-loaded former called. setting LaTeX see texPreview’s System Requirements, specific OS setup check Github Actions like MacOS example.

title: Onexit Usage in slackr
code: ctl <- c(4.17, 5.58, 5.18, 6.11, 4.50, 4.61, 5.17, 4.53, 5.33, 5.14) trt <- c(4.81, 4.17, 4.41, 3.59, 5.87, 3.83, 6.03, 4.89, 4.32, 4.69) group <- gl(2, 10, 20, labels = c("Ctl", "Trt")) weight <- c(ctl, trt)  # pass a message to Slack channel 'general' register_onexit(lm, "bazinga!", channel = "#general")  lm.D9 <- slack_lm(weight ~ group)  # test that output keeps inheritance summary(lm.D9)  # pass a message to Slack channel 'general' with a header message to begin output register_onexit(   lm,   "bazinga!",   channel = "#general",   header_msg = "This is a message to begin" )  lm.D9 <- slack_lm(weight ~ group)  # onexit with an expression that calls lm.plot register_onexit(   lm,   {     par(mfrow = c(2, 2), oma = c(0, 0, 2, 0))     plot(z) # z is the internal output of stats::lm()   },   channel = "#general",   header_msg = "This is a plot just for this output",   use_device = TRUE )  lm.D9 <- slack_lm(weight ~ group)  # clean up slack channel from examples slackr_delete(count = 6, channel = "#general")

title: Webhook Bot Setup
text: Setting single-channel bot simple. Go https://api.slack.com/apps Click “Create New App” follow setup instructions Click “Incoming Webhooks” “Features” Turn “Activate Incoming Webhooks” switch Click “Add New Webhook Workspace” Select channel ’d like bot post Copy Webhook URL Call slackr_setup(channel = '#channel_with_webhook', incoming_webhook_url = 'your_webhook'). can also follow config file setup directions instead passing channel webhook directly. ’s ! able post message slackr_bot('test message')

title: Webhook Bot Setup
code: library(slackr) slackr_setup()  slackr_bot('Test message',             channel = '#test',            username = 'mrkaye97',            icon_emoji = 'tada')

Contributor. Konrad Karczewski. Contributor. Shinya Uryu. Contributor. Gregory Jefferis. Contributor. Ed Niles. Contributor. Rick Saporta. Contributor. Jonathan Sidi. Author, contributor. Xinye Li. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kaye M, Rudis B, de Vries , Sidi J (2024). slackr: Send Messages, Images, R Objects Files 'Slack' Channels/Users. R package version 3.4.0, https://matthewrkaye.com/slackr/, https://github.com/mrkaye97/slackr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {slackr: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to 'Slack' Channels/Users},   author = {Matt Kaye and Bob Rudis and Andrie {de Vries} and Jonathan Sidi},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 3.4.0,     https://matthewrkaye.com/slackr/},   url = {https://github.com/mrkaye97/slackr}, }

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
text: slackr provides set tools making easier send messages, data, alerts, etc. directly R Slack. can use package send well-formatted output R teammates (specific individuals) time little effort. can send text, R function output, images current graphics device ggplots, R objects (R data files), rendered LaTeX expressions, uploaded files.

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
code: # CRAN version install.packages("slackr")  # Development version devtools::install_github("mrkaye97/slackr")

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
text: Version 3.0.0+ removes references bot_user_oauth_token (deprecated v2.4.0) favor token. also significant changes slackr slackr_bot handle errors. See changelog details. Version 2.4.0+ now allows users choose using bot token user token. See details check changelog (NEWS.md) changes.

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
text: three ways interfacing slackr provide significantly different functionality: Creating single-channel bot Using webhook send messages channel Creating fully-functional multi-channel bot Creating bot user send messages multiple channels, including plots, tables, files, etc. well deleting messages, reading channels workspace, etc. Using user token send messages specific user’s account Similar fully-scoped bot token, connected account single user. approach recommended production settings – settings token needs shared – can useful one-Slack messages lets users send data opposed bot. cases, recommend Option 1 . requires fewest permissions simplest set , allow basic messaging specific channel. See vignettes setup instructions.

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
text: vignettes contain setup instructions example usage: Option 1 setup: vignette('scoped-bot-setup', package = 'slackr') Option 2 setup: vignette('webhook-setup', package = 'slackr') Usage: vignette('using-slackr', package = 'slackr') Important Note: setup process Option 2 Option 3 roughly , slightly differing scopes.

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
text: slackr_setup() function try read setup values ~/.slackr (can change default filepath recording SLACKR_CONFIG_FILE_PATH environment variable supplying argument config_file parameter) configuration file, may easier secure passing manually (plus, allow multiple slackr configurations multiple Slack.com teams). file Debian Control File (DCF) format since really doesn’t need JSON R handy read.dcf() function since ’s DESCRIPTION files coded . ’s basic format configuration file: slackr 2.3.0, can create config file create_config_file() instead setting manually. See docs details. can also change default emoji icon (one setup integration creation time) icon_emoji.
code: token: xox*-<your app's token> channel: #general username: slackr incoming_webhook_url: https://hooks.slack.com/services/XXXXX/XXXXX/XXXXX icon_emoji: 'boom'

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
text: Many thanks : Bob Rudis Jay Jacobs David Severski Quinn Weber Konrad Karczewski Ed Niles Rick Saporta Jonathan Sidi Matt Kaye Xinye Li Andrie de Vries contributions package!

title: Send Messages, Images, R Objects and Files to Slack Channels/Users
text: Depending scopes, slackr quietly fail (.e. throw error, also post anything channel). happens, try explicitly adding app ’re trying slackr post channel want Slack workspace /invite @your_app_name make sure chat:write.public enabled.

what: A wrapper function to call the Slack API with authentication and pagination. — call_slack_api
title: A wrapper function to call the Slack API with authentication and pagination. — call_slack_api
text: wrapper function call Slack API authentication pagination.

title: A wrapper function to call the Slack API with authentication and pagination. — call_slack_api
code: call_slack_api(   path,   ...,   body = NULL,   .method = c("GET", "POST"),   token,   .verbose = Sys.getenv("SLACKR_VERBOSE", "FALSE"),   .next_cursor = "" )

title: A wrapper function to call the Slack API with authentication and pagination. — call_slack_api
text: path API definition path, e.g. /api/auth.test. ... arguments must named added API query string. body .method = POST body gets passed API body. .method Either "GET" "POST". token Authentication token bearing required scopes. .verbose TRUE, prints httr verbose messages.  Useful debugging. .next_cursor value next cursor, using pagination.

title: A wrapper function to call the Slack API with authentication and pagination. — call_slack_api
text: API response (named list)

what: Create the config file used in slackr_setup() — create_config_file
title: Create the config file used in slackr_setup() — create_config_file
text: Create config file used slackr_setup()

title: Create the config file used in slackr_setup() — create_config_file
code: create_config_file(   filename = "~/.slackr",   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   incoming_webhook_url = Sys.getenv("SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL"),   icon_emoji = Sys.getenv("SLACK_ICON_EMOJI"),   username = Sys.getenv("SLACK_USERNAME"),   channel = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL") )

title: Create the config file used in slackr_setup() — create_config_file
text: filename name config file save. recommend using hidden file (starting '.') token Authentication token bearing required scopes. incoming_webhook_url incoming webhook URL (Default: whatever set env var). icon_emoji icon emoji use default. username username send messages (default "slackr" username set). channel Channel, private group, IM channel send message . Can encoded ID, name. See chat.postMessage endpoint documentation details.

title: Create the config file used in slackr_setup() — create_config_file
text: TRUE successful (invisibly)

title: Create the config file used in slackr_setup() — create_config_file
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # using `create_config_file()` after `slackr_setup()` create_config_file()  # using `create_config_file()` before `slackr_setup()` create_config_file(   token = "xox-",   incoming_webhook_url = "https://hooks-",   channel = "#general",   username = "slackr",   icon_emoji = "tada" )  slackr_setup() } # }

what: Post a ggplot to a Slack channel — ggslackr
title: Post a ggplot to a Slack channel — ggslackr
text: Unlike slackr_dev() function, one takes ggplot object, eliminating need graphics device (think use scripts).

title: Post a ggplot to a Slack channel — ggslackr
code: ggslackr(   plot = ggplot2::last_plot(),   channels = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   file = "ggplot.png",   initial_comment = NULL,   thread_ts = NULL,   title = NULL,   ... )

title: Post a ggplot to a Slack channel — ggslackr
text: plot ggplot object save, defaults last plot displayed. channels Comma-separated list channel names IDs file shared. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. file Prefix filenames (defaults ggplot). initial_comment message text introducing file specified channels. thread_ts Provide another message's ts value upload file reply. Never use reply's ts value; use parent instead. title Title file. ... arguments passed ggsave

title: Post a ggplot to a Slack channel — ggslackr
text: httr response object (invisibly)

title: Post a ggplot to a Slack channel — ggslackr

what: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
text: Appends body function .exit call run end call.

title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
code: register_onexit(   f,   ...,   header_msg = NULL,   use_device = FALSE,   env = parent.frame(2),   channel = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   username = Sys.getenv("SLACK_USERNAME"),   icon_emoji = Sys.getenv("SLACK_ICON_EMOJI"),   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN") )

title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
text: f function character. ... expressions sent Slack. header_msg boolean, message append start Slack output, Default: NULL. use_device boolean, passes current image graphics device Slack part f, Default: FALSE. env environment assign appended function relation function environment, Default: parent.frame(2) (global environment). channel Channel, private group, IM channel send message . Can encoded ID, name. See chat.postMessage endpoint documentation details. username user bot named (chr). icon_emoji emoji use (chr) "" mean use default. token Authentication token bearing required scopes.

title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
text: function

title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
text: character passed f evaluate internally function.

title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
text: need https://www.slack.com account also need set API token https://api.slack.com/

title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
text: Jonathan Sidi (aut)

title: Append slackr_msg as on.exit to functions. — register_onexit
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ctl <- c(4.17, 5.58, 5.18, 6.11, 4.50, 4.61, 5.17, 4.53, 5.33, 5.14) trt <- c(4.81, 4.17, 4.41, 3.59, 5.87, 3.83, 6.03, 4.89, 4.32, 4.69) group <- gl(2, 10, 20, labels = c("Ctl", "Trt")) weight <- c(ctl, trt)  # pass a message to Slack channel 'general' register_onexit(lm, "bazinga!", channel = "#general")  lm.D9 <- slack_lm(weight ~ group)  # test that output keeps inheritance summary(lm.D9)  # pass a message to Slack channel 'general' with a header message to begin output register_onexit(   lm,   "bazinga!",   channel = "#general",   header_msg = "This is a message to begin" )  lm.D9 <- slack_lm(weight ~ group)  # onexit with an expression that calls lm.plot register_onexit(   lm,   {     par(mfrow = c(2, 2), oma = c(0, 0, 2, 0))     plot(z)   },   channel = "#general",   header_msg = "This is a plot just for this output",   use_device = TRUE )  lm.D9 <- slack_lm(weight ~ group)  # clean up slack channel from examples slackr_delete(count = 6, channel = "#general") } # }

what: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
title: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
text: Takes expr, evaluates sends output Slack chat destination. Useful logging, messaging long compute tasks general information sharing.

title: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
code: slackr(   ...,   channel = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   username = Sys.getenv("SLACK_USERNAME"),   icon_emoji = Sys.getenv("SLACK_ICON_EMOJI"),   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   thread_ts = NULL,   reply_broadcast = FALSE )

title: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
text: ... expressions sent Slack. channel Channel, private group, IM channel send message . Can encoded ID, name. See chat.postMessage endpoint documentation details. username user bot named (chr). icon_emoji emoji use (chr) "" mean use default. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. thread_ts Provide another message's ts value make message reply. Avoid using reply's ts value; use parent instead. reply_broadcast Used conjunction thread_ts indicates whether reply made visible everyone channel conversation. Defaults FALSE.

title: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
text: response (invisibly)

title: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
text: default, everything expr looked "SLACK_" environment variable. can override just specify values directly instead, probably better call slackr_setup() first.

title: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
text: need https://www.slack.com account also need set API token https://api.slack.com/

title: Output R expressions to a Slack channel/user — slackr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ slackr_setup() slackr("iris info", head(iris), str(iris)) } # }

title: Send result of R expressions to a Slack channel via webhook API — slackr_bot
text: default, everything expr looked "SLACK_" environment variable. can override just specify values directly instead, probably better call slackr_setup() first.

what: Send a data frame to Slack as a CSV — slackr_csv
title: Send a data frame to Slack as a CSV — slackr_csv
text: slackr_csv simplifies process sending data frame Slack CSV file. highly recommended leave filename argument default (tempfile), changing persist csv file working directory.

title: Send a data frame to Slack as a CSV — slackr_csv
code: slackr_csv(   data,   filename = tempfile(fileext = ".csv"),   title = NULL,   initial_comment = NULL,   channels = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   thread_ts = NULL,   ... )

title: Send a data frame to Slack as a CSV — slackr_csv
text: data data frame tibble upload. filename file save . Defaults tempfile. Using default highly advised, using non-tempfile write file persists disk (either working directory, location specified). title Title file. initial_comment message text introducing file specified channels. channels Comma-separated list channel names IDs file shared. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. thread_ts Provide another message's ts value upload file reply. Never use reply's ts value; use parent instead. ... additional arguments passed write.csv().

title: Send a data frame to Slack as a CSV — slackr_csv

what: Reads history of a channel. — slackr_history
title: Reads history of a channel. — slackr_history
text: Returns dataframe post history channel.

title: Reads history of a channel. — slackr_history
code: slackr_history(   message_count = 100,   channel = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   posted_to_time = as.numeric(Sys.time()),   duration = NULL,   posted_from_time = 0,   paginate = FALSE,   inclusive = TRUE )

title: Reads history of a channel. — slackr_history
text: message_count number messages retrieve (paginate = FALSE). Corresponds limit conversations.history docs. Note: using pagination, setting value (e.g.) 1 result paginating channel's history one message time. Slack recommends using value 200. (Default: 100) channel Channel, private group, IM channel send message . Can encoded ID, name. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. posted_to_time Timestamp last post consider. Corresponds latest conversations.history docs. Default: current time. duration Number hours history retrieve.  neither duration posted_from_time specified, time limit retrieved history. (default: NULL) posted_from_time Timestamp first post time consider. posted_to_time duration specifed, take precedence. Corresponds oldest conversations.history docs. Default: 0 paginate TRUE, uses Slack API pagination mechanism, retrieve history inside timeframe.  Otherwise, makes single call API retrieves maximum message_count messages. inclusive Include messages oldest latest timestamps results. Ignored unless either timestamp specified.

title: Reads history of a channel. — slackr_history
text: tibble message metadata

title: Reads history of a channel. — slackr_history
text: need one scopes enabled slack app: * channels:history * groups:history * im:history * mpim:history

title: Reads history of a channel. — slackr_history

title: Sends a message to a slack channel. — slackr_msg
code: slackr_msg(   txt = "",   channel = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   username = Sys.getenv("SLACK_USERNAME"),   icon_emoji = Sys.getenv("SLACK_ICON_EMOJI"),   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   thread_ts = NULL,   reply_broadcast = FALSE,   ... )

title: Sends a message to a slack channel. — slackr_msg
text: txt text message send Slack. character vector length > 1 passed , combined separated newlines. channel Channel, private group, IM channel send message . Can encoded ID, name. See chat.postMessage endpoint documentation details. username user bot named (chr). icon_emoji emoji use (chr) "" mean use default. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. thread_ts Provide another message's ts value make message reply. Avoid using reply's ts value; use parent instead. reply_broadcast Used conjunction thread_ts indicates whether reply made visible everyone channel conversation. Defaults FALSE. ... arguments passed Slack API chat.postMessage call

title: Sends a message to a slack channel. — slackr_msg
text: response (invisibly)

title: Sends a message to a slack channel. — slackr_msg
text: need https://www.slack.com account also need setup API token https://api.slack.com/ Also, can pass add_user=TRUE part ... parameters Slack API post message logged-user account (override anything set username)

title: Sends a message to a slack channel. — slackr_msg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ slackr_setup() slackr_msg("Hi") } # }

what: Save R objects to an RData file on Slack — slackr_save
title: Save R objects to an RData file on Slack — slackr_save
text: slackr_save enables upload R objects (R data file) Slack (optionally) post one channels (channels empty).

title: Save R objects to an RData file on Slack — slackr_save
code: slackr_save(   ...,   channels = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   file = "slackr",   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   initial_comment = NULL,   title = NULL,   thread_ts = NULL )

title: Save R objects to an RData file on Slack — slackr_save
text: ... objects store R data file. channels Comma-separated list channel names IDs file shared. file filename (without extension) use. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. initial_comment message text introducing file specified channels. title Title file. thread_ts Provide another message's ts value upload file reply. Never use reply's ts value; use parent instead.

title: Save R objects to an RData file on Slack — slackr_save
text: httr response object POST call

title: Save R objects to an RData file on Slack — slackr_save
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ slackr_setup() slackr_save(mtcars, channels = "#slackr", file = "mtcars") } # }

what: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
title: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
text: Initialize environment variables slackr() need use work properly.

title: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
code: slackr_setup(   channel = "#general",   username = "slackr",   icon_emoji = "",   incoming_webhook_url = "",   token = "",   config_file = Sys.getenv("SLACKR_CONFIG_FILE_PATH", unset = "~/.slackr"),   echo = FALSE,   cache_dir = "" )

title: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
text: channel default channel send output (chr) defaults #general. username username output appear (chr) defaults slackr. icon_emoji emoji picture use (chr) defaults none (can left blank config file well). incoming_webhook_url Slack URL prefix use (chr) defaults none. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. config_file configuration file (DCF) - see read.dcf - format config values. echo display configuration variables (bool) initially FALSE. cache_dir location -disk cache. defaults -memory cache location specified.

title: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
text: "Successfully connected Slack"

title: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
text: default, slackr() (functions) use #general room username slackr() emoji. valid file found location pointed config_file, values used. fields specified file:
code: token: SLACK_TOKEN  channel: #general  username: slackr  incoming_webhook_url: https://hooks.slack.com/services/XXXXX/XXXXX/XXXXX

title: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
text: need Slack account API URLs & tokens setup use package.

title: Setup environment variables for Slack API access — slackr_setup
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # reads from default file (i.e. ~/.slackr) slackr_setup()  # reads from alternate config slackr_setup(config_file = "/path/to/my/slackrconfig")  # the hard way slackr_setup(   channel = "#code",   incoming_webhook_url = "https://hooks.slack.com/services/XXXXX/XXXXX/XXXXX" ) } # }

what: Post a tex output to a Slack channel — slackr_tex
title: Post a tex output to a Slack channel — slackr_tex
text: Unlike slackr_dev() function, one takes tex object, eliminating need write pdf convert png pass slack.

title: Post a tex output to a Slack channel — slackr_tex
code: slackr_tex(   obj,   channels = Sys.getenv("SLACK_CHANNEL"),   token = Sys.getenv("SLACK_TOKEN"),   ext = "png",   path = NULL,   title = NULL,   initial_comment = NULL,   thread_ts = NULL,   ... )

title: Post a tex output to a Slack channel — slackr_tex
text: obj character object containing tex compile. channels Comma-separated list channel names IDs file shared. token Authentication token bearing required scopes. ext character, type format return, can tex, pdf, image device, Default: 'png'. path character, path save tex_preview outputs, NULL tempdir used, Default: NULL. title Title file. initial_comment message text introducing file specified channels. thread_ts Provide another message's ts value upload file reply. Never use reply's ts value; use parent instead. ... arguments passed texPreview::tex_preview(), see Details

title: slackr 3.4.0
text: Fixes internals files_upload use new Slack API migrate deprecated files.upload method

title: slackr 3.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-26 Fixes bug slackr_history function fails infer posted_from_time provided Adds default message_count = 100 slackr_history Improves test coverage

title: slackr 3.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-20 User-facing changes: ggslackr now relies dots (...) pass arguments ggsave ggplot2 now suggests, user doesn’t need installed use slackr. ggslackr prompt install ’s already. Fixes “bug” pagination slackr_history causing almost infinite loop Fixes bug slackr_save initial_comment nothing Improves documentation slackr_history helpful pointing user Slack API docs Backend changes: Gets rid default args un-exported functions make tracking bugs easier Adds significant test coverage

title: slackr 3.2.2
text: Fixes bug specifying specifying duration effect slackr_history() posted_from_time specified also. linked issue

title: slackr 3.2.1
text: Fixes bug specifying thread_ts reply_broadcast slackr nothing

title: slackr 3.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-20 slackr slackr_bot longer rely reprex, prex_r fail eval environment needed specified, couldn’t.

title: slackr 3.1.1
text: slackr_ims bug fix. Using usethis::use_pipe() import magrittr’s pipe.

title: slackr 3.1.0
text: Allows ggslackr post multiple file types Fixes bug slackr slackr_bot led garbled output

title: slackr 3.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-20 Fixes couple bugs * Updated error handling edge cases supply username user token. * Removes references purrr, since ’s GPL. * Updates vignettes

title: slackr 3.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-07 Lots breaking changes release: * bot_user_oauth_token removed entirely favor token * slackr_history now message_count ’s first argument * Adding capability pass thread_ts parameter slackr_* functions (.e. allowing reply message thread) * Adding reply_broadcast capability slackr slackr_msg * Adding title initial_comment parameters functions relying files.upload endpoint (basically everything except slackr, slackr_bot, slackr_msg, slackr_history, slackr_delete) * slackr slackr_bot now use reprex::prex() background, means longer throw errors way . slackr try helpful telling went wrong prex output contains error (instead posting), isn’t guaranteed work time. can prevent behavior setting SLACKR_ERRORS environment variable "IGNORE". changes: * Significant improvements documentation, now aligns Slack API descriptions * Significant internal overhauls functions call API

title: slackr 2.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-06 Small bug fix ggslackr

title: slackr 2.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-05 Deprecates bot_user_oauth_token argument slackr* functions favor token Allows users choose user token bot token Uses withr::local_options(list(cli.num_colors = 1)) inside slackr fix garbled tibble printing. linked issue Removes channel, username icon_emoji parameters slackr_bot() deprecated version 2.1.1 effect Removes cacheChannels parameter slackr_setup() deprecated version 2.1.0 Removes hard-coded locale settings. linked issue Small error handling improvements miscellaneous fixes

title: slackr 2.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-02 Adds slackr_csv(), simplifies process writing data frames Slack csv files Adds slackr_teardown(), reverts changes made slackr_setup() unsetting environment variables Adds create_config_file() simplify process setting config file save_slackr() now deprecated favor slackr_save() tex_slackr() deprecated favor slackr_tex()

title: slackr 2.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-04 Gets rid usage slackr_chtrans() vast majority functions, significantly speeding slackr_***() limiting API requests

title: slackr 2.1.3
text: Fixes memoise bug causing slackr_chtrans() fail memoise < 2.0.0 Fixes bug implementation slackr_census() cause slackr_census() fail user specifying cache dir disk

title: slackr 2.1.2
text: Fixes vignettes, knit displayed pkgdown site

title: slackr 2.1.1
text: Changes badly-set function default channels Sys.getenv('SLACK_CHANNEL') instead '' Adds informative error message slackr_upload() request returns authed per #137 Deprecates arguments slackr_bot() longer work (username, channel, icon emoji) used work old API structure

title: slackr 2.1.0
text: HTTP Caching speeds requests limits number requests need make slackr_history() slackr_delete() now implemented username icon_emoji parameters slackr_*** functions now work https://matthewrkaye.com/slackr/articles/webhook-setup.html added setup instructions usage Improved error messaging Updates README pkgdown site number significant back-end changes, thanks Andrie de Vries, including significant code cleanup, simplification API calls, pagination, !

title: slackr 2.0.2
text: bug fixes sets CI GH Actions

title: slackr 2.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-19 Documentation suggested fixes common bugs

title: slackr 2.0.0
text: Fixes work new Slack API

title: slackr 1.5.0
text: TONS improvements / additions Fixes CRAN issues

title: slackr 1.4.3
text: Added stop() slackr_upload() file upload found (via #46)

title: slackr 1.4.2
text: CRAN release: 2016-07-20 Fixed bug introduced new field names Slack API Added NEWS.md file track changes package.

title: slackr 1.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2016-04-27 new slackr_msg() function behaves slightly differently text_slackr() Versions 1.4+ BREAK THINGS. Support removed “old style” incoming web hooks (see “Setup” README required incoming web hook URL format). incoming webhook “token” longer required used.
